main event: A bright, large, orange object was observed moving quickly from south to west over Concord, Massachusetts on June 14, 1960.
interesting points: The object was first seen in the south-southwest, then moved rapidly to the west.
The object appeared to be blinking or flashing.
The object rose up behind trees and climbed in the sky to the west.
The speed of the object was considered excessive for a balloon.
The object was described as a very large, bright, orange light.
